title: LeBron scores 8; record double-digit streak ends
content: LeBron James had a chance to extend his record double-digit scoring streak but opted to pass the ball, setting up Rui Hachimura's winning 3-pointer at the buzzer Thursday night against the Raptors.

title: St. Brown toughs out injury, fuels Lions in key win
content: Lions receiver Amon-Ra St. Brown, who played through an ankle injury Thursday night, said he was willing to do "whatever it takes" to be on the field and came up big in a 44-30 win over the Cowboys.

title: Cowboys 'not deflated' by harder path to playoffs
content: Cowboys quarterback Dak Prescott said the team would use Thursday night's loss to the Lions, and the tougher odds to make the postseason, as "fuel" with four games to go.

title: Sources: Penn St. turns focus to ISU's Campbell
content: Iowa State coach Matt Campbell has emerged as the focus of Penn State's head coaching search, sources told ESPN.

title: Maxey's 'amazing' block preserves 76ers' win
content: Tyrese Maxey's block of De'Anthony Melton in the final seconds preserved the 76ers 99-98 win over the Warriors on Thursday night.

title: Gottlieb tosses chair after Green Bay blows game
content: Green Bay coach Doug Gottlieb threw a chair as he walked off the court after his team blew an 11-point lead in an "embarrassing" 80-78 loss to Robert Morris.

title: Pirates send Oviedo to Red Sox in 5-player deal
content: The Red Sox acquired right-hander Johan Oviedo from the Pirates in a five-player trade that sent outfield prospect Jhostynxon Garcia, also known as "The Password," to Pittsburgh.

title: K-State hires former star QB Klein as head coach
content: Collin Klein, the former Kansas State quarterback and current offensive coordinator at Texas A&M, was named the Wildcats' head coach on Thursday night.

title: üìà Men's hoops Power Rankings: Wolverines feast
content: The Wolverines had perhaps the best Feast Week to take them over Arizona and Purdue in a roller-coaster No. 1 race.

title: LeBron and the legend of the eight points: 'I will be showing my son this box score'
content: Not many can recall the last time LeBron James scored fewer than 10 points. Why? Because it was in 2007.

content: Kenneth Walker III, Jonathan Gannon, Shedeur Sanders and Matt Eberflus are among those with a lot to gain -- or lose -- over the season's final five weeks.

content: We polled PHWA voters to find out who's ahead in the major races -- and some clear favorites have emerged.

content: Can the ACC make noise when LSU-Duke, Notre Dame-Ole Miss, UNC-Texas and more meet on Wednesday and Thursday?

title: 'I'm a Tiger 'til I die': Why Flau'jae Johnson returned for one last run at LSU
content: Flau'jae Johnson could have left for the WNBA. Instead, she came back for a final season to give LSU all she has left.

title: 'A self-inflicted wound': Why Ole Miss finally had enough of Lane Kiffin
content: How the long courtship of the Rebels coach finally came to a head, amid secret meetings and middle fingers.

title: How did Ohio State's Julian Sayin get so accurate? QB H-O-R-S-E
content: Sayin enters the Big Ten championship game on the verge of breaking the FBS completion percentage record.

title: Indiana freshman defies death, makes NCAA volleyball tournament
content: Toxic shock syndrome nearly killed Charlotte Vinson. Now she's hoping to help Indiana advance at the NCAA tournament.

title: Champions League places? Man United still haven't shown they're worthy of one
content: A top-four spot is well within Manchester United's reach. But after their draw vs. West Ham, it's unclear whether they want it.

title: A week to save his job? Is Slot under serious pressure at Liverpool now?
content: Liverpool have suffered nine defeats and a draw in their past 14 games in all competitions. Is it time for manager Arne Slot to go?

content: An all-encompassing look at the matchups to exploit or avoid and lineup locks in fantasy, as well as projected scores for all NFL games.

content: Players trending up to add for the playoffs and what to do with three stars headed in the wrong direction.

content: The founder of the Temptations gave a glimpse into what fans can expect in their historic Detroit Lions performance, along with special moments that intersected soul and the Lions.

content: The 2026 recruiting cycle is almost finished. Here's how this class will impact college football next season.

title: One thing to know about 2026 World Cup qualified teams ahead of draw
content: The FIFA World Cup draw is happening Friday, and 42 of the 48 teams are confirmed. But what's one thing you need to know about each nation?

title: Lionel Messi exclusive: Argentina star talks World Cup, Inter Miami, more
content: Lionel Messi sits down for a lengthy interview with ESPN, discussing his desire to again lead Argentina, the brilliance of Lionel Scaloni and why Pep Guardiola is one of "the best" ever.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Real Madrid, Man United eye Mouzakitis
content: Real Madrid could rival Manchester United to sign Olympiacos wonderkid Christos Mouzakitis. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: F1 finale: History haunts McLaren, beckons for Verstappen
content: At F1's season finale, McLaren's parallels to past heartbreaks are hard to ignore as Max Verstappen's long-shot title bid doesn't look so far fetched.

title: Don't be surprised if ... Collin Gillespie, Austin Reaves continue hot scoring runs
content: Eric Karabell forecasts what to expect from notable players, like Collin Gillespie, Trae Young and more.

title: 'Agreed on economic cooperation plan till 2030': PM Modi in joint statement with Putin - top quotes
content: Prime Minister Modi hailed India-Russia ties as a "North star" in a changing world, announcing an economic cooperation program until 2030. Both nations reaffirmed their commitment to energy security and combating terrorism. Discussions also covered trade, with Russia pledging continued fuel shipments to India's growing economy.

title: IND vs SA: 'Where was the intent?' - Ex-cricketer slams Jadeja, blames knock for Raipur defeat
content: Former India all-rounder Irfan Pathan criticised Ravindra Jadeja's slow batting in the second ODI loss to South Africa. Pathan believes Jadeja's lack of urgency, scoring 24 off 27 balls, cost India crucial runs. Despite centuries from Kohli and Gaikwad, the team failed to capitalise fully, allowing South Africa to chase a formidable target.

title: Frustrated, lying on floors, confused: Videos capture chaos as IndiGo cancels 500+ flights; watch
content: India's aviation sector faced a severe meltdown as IndiGo cancelled over 400 flights, leaving thousands stranded and airports in chaos. Passengers endured long waits and exorbitant fares on other airlines due to the crisis, triggered by cabin crew shortages. IndiGo expects full operational recovery only by February 2026, highlighting a significant disruption.

title: US visa update: H-1B, H-4 applicants to face social media checks
content: The US State Department is tightening visa vetting, requiring H-1B workers and H-4 dependents to undergo social media screening from December 15. Applicants must set accounts to public and disclose all usernames from the past five years, including inactive ones. This expanded review aims to enhance national security by identifying potential threats.

title: 'Murdered all kids on Ekadashi': Occult omen or mental illness? Disturbing pattern of Haryana's 'killer mom'
content: A mother in Hisar/Panipat is accused of drowning four children, including her own son. While her family and victims' kin suspect occult practices, police point to psychopathic tendencies and a lack of remorse. The accused reportedly confessed to killing children perceived as more beautiful than her own. Authorities are investigating further, dismissing supernatural claims.

title: Starc breaks Pak legend's big record: 'Super Starc!' ‚Äî Wasim Akram posts classy message
content: Mitchell Starc has become the most successful left-arm fast bowler in Test history, surpassing Wasim Akram's 414 wickets with a stellar 6/75 performance. Akram lauded Starc as a worthy successor, but the Australian humbly stated Akram remains the benchmark. Starc now ranks among Australia's top wicket-takers, with his pursuit of further milestones ongoing.

title: IndiGo crisis: Bengaluru couple attends own wedding reception virtually
content: A newlywed couple, stranded in Bhubaneswar due to IndiGo flight cancellations, virtually attended their own wedding reception in Hubballi.  Their parents represented them at the venue, with the couple appearing on a large screen via video call.  This incident highlights the widespread travel chaos caused by airline operational issues, prompting calls for government intervention.

title: Cloudflare goes down again: CTO Dane Knecht confirms outage; shares root cause
content: Cloudflare experienced another widespread outage on Friday, affecting major websites like Canva and Zoom. The company's CTO revealed the root cause was disabling logging features to address a React CVE. While services are now restored, this marks the second significant disruption in a month, raising concerns about network stability and prompting further investigation.

title: Watch: Chaos at Barabati! Fans sprint and break queues for IND‚ÄìSA T20I tickets
content: Thousands of passionate Indian cricket fans descended upon Cuttack's Barabati Stadium for tickets to the India vs. South Africa T20I, resulting in chaotic scenes. A viral video captured a frenzied crowd pushing and surging towards ticket counters, raising concerns about public safety amidst intense demand for the upcoming series.

title: ‚ÄòOpportunity for us‚Äô: RBI governor sees impact of Trump tariffs as ‚Äòminimal‚Äô
content: RBI Governor Sanjay Malhotra views US tariffs on Indian economy as a minimal impact, calling it an opportunity for diversification and productivity improvements. Despite a significant 28.5% drop in exports to the US from May to October 2025, the central bank believes the domestic demand-driven economy will emerge stronger.

title: Bezos' ex-wife makes bold move: Amazon stake sale funds Howard University gift
content: MacKenzie Scott has significantly reduced her Amazon stake, donating billions to diversity, equity, and inclusion initiatives. Her recent $80 million gift to Howard University highlights her focus on substantial contributions to DEI and disaster relief causes. Despite these large donations, Scott remains a prominent philanthropist.

title: High cholesterol symptoms in legs at night: Warning signs you should never ignore
content: Leg pain, numbness, coldness, swelling, and skin changes, especially at night, can signal high LDL cholesterol. These symptoms indicate reduced blood flow due to arterial plaque buildup, potentially leading to serious heart issues. Early detection through regular monitoring and lifestyle changes is crucial for managing 'bad cholesterol' and protecting your health.

title: ‚ÄòDoomsday plane‚Äô: What is the ‚ÄòFlying Kremlin‚Äô? Putin‚Äôs jet was the most-tracked flight
content: Russian President Vladimir Putin's specially modified Ilyushin Il-80, dubbed the ‚ÄúFlying Kremlin,‚Äù became the world's most tracked flight en route to Delhi. This secure airborne command center, designed for extreme conditions and equipped with advanced communication and defensive systems, underscores Russia's strategic leadership protection.

title: Kobe Bryant slammed by alleged friend, claims he 'wasn‚Äôt a good person'
content: New claims suggest NBA legend Kobe Bryant was not a good person and neglected family and friends. An alleged childhood friend shared disappointment over unmet promises of support. This contrasts with Kobe's documented generosity and mentorship. The allegations have sparked debate online, highlighting the complex nature of his legacy. Kobe's life included both personal challenges and significant positive contributions.

title: Travis Kelce‚Äôs bold Europe comments on Taylor Swift spark future rumors
content: Travis Kelce recently spoke about his trip to Lake Como with Taylor Swift. He described the beautiful scenery and the warmth of the local people. Kelce expressed his joy and wonder at the experience, finding a new appreciation for life's pace. George Clooney also joined the conversation, sharing his own fondness for the Italian region.

title: Los Angeles Lakers vs Toronto Raptors regular season game - Full injury report
content: The Lakers and Raptors face significant injury woes as they clash on December 4, 2025. With Luka Doncic and Marcus Smart out for LA, and Jakob Poeltl and RJ Barrett sidelined for Toronto, depth players will be crucial. This game becomes a test of adaptability and which supporting cast can step up.

title: Bomb scare on Dubai‚ÄìHyderabad Emirates flight: Threat email sparks alert; aircraft lands safely at RGIA
content: Hyderabad Airport faced a bomb threat for an Emirates flight from Dubai on Friday, prompting standard safety protocols upon landing. Passengers were safely deplaned after the aircraft was moved to an isolated bay. This incident follows a string of similar threats targeting flights to the city, raising security concerns.

title: Top neurologist reveals the hidden reasons behind a stroke
content: Strokes strike young adults under 45 more often than before, often from sneaky causes missed in routine checkups. While older adults face plaque buildup, youth deal with heart holes, vessel tears, blood clotting glitches, lipid quirks, and silent sugar issues

title: Bigg Boss 19 reveals the first look of its trophy as the top 5 finalists are announced
content: Bigg Boss 19's grand finale is just two days away, with Gaurav Khanna, Tanya Mittal, Amaal Mallik, Pranit More, and Farrhana Bhatt now the Top 5 finalists. The show unveiled its 'Gharwalon ki Sarkaar' themed trophy, incorporating Salman Khan's signature gesture. Malti Chahar's exit followed a heated exchange, leaving the finalists to pick their preferred winner, sparking further arguments.

title: LeBron ends 1,297-game double-digit streak but delivers winning assist vs Raptors
content: LeBron James' record 1,297-game scoring streak ended Thursday night. He chose to pass for a game-winning shot instead of scoring himself. The Los Angeles Lakers secured a 123-120 victory over the Toronto Raptors. James' focus remains on team success. This unselfish play highlights his commitment to winning above personal milestones.

title: Watch: Rasgulla shortage sparks massive brawl at Bihar wedding
content: In Bodh Gaya, a wedding celebration took an unexpected turn when a lack of rasgullas ignited a fierce altercation between the families. The groom's relatives argue that the dessert shortage was the trigger for the uproar, while the bride's family insists that unresolved dowry negotiations were the real cause, leading to injuries and a stalled ceremony.

title: Ashwin decodes Kohli's fiery celebrations; says he is out to prove a point
content: Former India spinner Ravichandran Ashwin believes Virat Kohli is playing with a point to prove after taking whispers about his future to heart. Kohli's animated celebrations and agreement to play the Vijay Hazare Trophy suggest a fierce self-assertion, as he demonstrates renewed technique and ruthless intent, silencing doubts with back-to-back centuries.

title: Alia Bhatt shares glimpses of griha pravesh puja with Ranbir Kapoor
content: Alia Bhatt and Ranbir Kapoor moved into their new six-storey Pali Hill bungalow with daughter Raha and Neetu Kapoor. Marking both their griha pravesh puja and Raha‚Äôs third birthday, Alia shared heartfelt photos featuring family rituals, tender moments, and glimpses of their lavish Rs 250-crore Mumbai home.

title: 'Dhurandhar' Twitter review: Fans hail Ranveer Singh as a 'beast' and call the Sanjay Dutt, Akshaye Khanna, Arjun Rampal, Rakesh Bedi starrer 'paisa vasool'
content: Ranveer Singh's highly anticipated spy thriller 'Dhurandhar' has hit cinemas, earning praise for its ensemble cast, gripping plot, and BGM. Netizens are calling it a 'paisa vasool' entertainer, with Ranveer Singh's performance hailed as 'phenomenal' and Akshaye Khanna stealing scenes. Despite a lengthy runtime, the film is predicted to be a box office success.

title: IndiGo cancellations: On-time performance crashes to 8.5%! Over 400 flights cancelled
content: IndiGo's operational crisis deepened as on-time performance plummeted to 8.5% at major airports, leading to widespread cancellations and delays. The airline cancelled hundreds of flights, stranding passengers amidst overwhelming airport conditions. The DGCA has mandated a recovery roadmap, with IndiGo aiming for operational stability by February 2026.

title: 'Vanished in minutes': Kohli fever sells out Vizag ODI; Kaif's post captures frenzy
content: Virat Kohli's sensational return to form, marked by back-to-back centuries, has ignited a nationwide frenzy, selling out the Visakhapatnam ODI against South Africa.  Sluggish ticket sales were reversed overnight, with fans clamoring to witness the phenomenon.  Even high prices couldn't dampen the demand, showcasing Kohli's immense impact on Indian cricket.

title: ‚ÄòFaulty intel‚Äô: Family after US raid kills Syrian undercover agent; IS militant was target
content: A US-led raid in Syria, intended to capture an ISIS official, tragically killed a man reportedly working undercover for intelligence. Khaled al-Masoud's family claims he was a spy for a Syrian opposition group, not a jihadist.  The operation, involving US forces and the Syrian Free Army, has raised questions about faulty intelligence and accountability for his death.

title: Persimmon superfruit: Why it loves your heart and the best ways to eat it
content: Discover the persimmon, a new heart-healthy hero. This bright orange fruit offers sweet flavor and a nutrient boost. Research shows persimmons outperform apples in protecting arteries. They are rich in fiber and antioxidants, supporting heart health, digestion, and immunity. Enjoy persimmons in salads, yogurt, or as dried chips for a healthy snack.

title: 'Blinded Pakistan air's defences': IAF recalls day 3 of 1971 war; shares rare images
content: The Indian Air Force commemorated its pivotal role on December 5, 1971, the third day of the war. IAF operations crippled Pakistan's western defenses and devastated enemy airfields. In the east, air superiority paved the way for India's rapid advance, leading to Bangladesh's birth. The Battle of Longewala also saw IAF Hunters decisively halt a Pakistani armored thrust, securing Jaisalmer.

title: Chinese couple shocked after fair-haired, blue-eyed baby is born
content: A Chinese couple expecting a baby with East Asian features was surprised when their daughter was born with blonde hair and blue eyes. A paternity test confirmed the child was theirs, revealing a hidden Slavic ancestor. This fascinating genetic throwback, known as atavism, highlights the enduring power of recessive genes across generations.

title: 'Forceful exit': Harbhajan sympathises with Virat, Rohit; backs them for 2027 World Cup
content: Harbhajan Singh expressed disappointment over the way Indian legends Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma have been treated amid talk of a forced transition, saying many greats before them were similarly sidelined. He criticised those ‚Äúwho haven‚Äôt achieved much‚Äù for deciding the duo‚Äôs future, while praising Kohli and Rohit for their dominant ODI form and backing them as ideal role models ‚Äî and contenders for the 2027 ODI World Cup.

title: Candace Owens roasted for 'backing out' of TPUSA's Charlie Kirk livestream challenge
content: Candace Owens is facing criticism for contradicting herself. She publicly offered to debate Turning Point USA (TPUSA) leadership anytime, anywhere. However, when TPUSA scheduled a livestream to address her claims, Owens pushed back on the logistics. Critics accuse her of creating drama rather than accepting the challenge she initiated. The situation has become a test of consistency for the commentator.

title: Meesho IPO day 3: Should you subscribe the issue? Check GMP, price band, rating & more
content: Meesho's IPO is nearing its close, attracting significant investor interest with a 7.97 times oversubscription. The Rs 5,421 crore issue, priced between Rs 105-111, shows strong retail and institutional demand. Analysts are cautiously optimistic, citing growth potential despite current losses, with a potential listing gain of around 44.59%.

title: Bags lost, long queues, passengers stranded: IndiGo's nationwide crisis persists ‚Äî key developments
content: IndiGo's operational crisis has caused widespread chaos for four days, leading to over 550 flight cancellations and stranding thousands of passengers. The airline attributes the disruption to unforeseen challenges and revised crew duty rules, while the DGCA points to misjudged manpower needs. Operations are expected to stabilize by February 10, 2026.

title: 'Full-blown fiasco': As IndiGo fails to fly, chaos at Bengaluru airport; 102 flights cancelled
content: IndiGo flights faced massive disruptions across India on Thursday. Bengaluru alone saw 52 arrivals and 50 departures cancelled. Passengers experienced long queues and uncertainty. The airline cited pilot shortages and crew duty limits. IndiGo has requested operational exemptions until February 10, 2026, to stabilize operations. Fares on other airlines increased significantly amid the crisis.

title: CCTV captures assault: Jeweller stabbed to death during robbery; accused watched 25 ‚Äòtutorials'
content: A shocking daylight robbery turned fatal in Modinagar. A 75-year-old jeweller was brutally stabbed to death by an assailant who threw chilli powder in his face. The attacker was quickly caught by alert locals after a brief chase. The incident highlights concerns over law and order in the area. Police are investigating the motive and have detained the suspect.

title: Why RBI cut repo rate even with low inflation, high growth? Sanjay Malhotra explains
content: The Reserve Bank of India has reduced the repo rate by 25 basis points to 5.25%, citing benign inflation and a resilient economy. Despite a strong GDP growth forecast of 7.3% for the fiscal year, the central bank sees potential softening ahead. This move aims to support growth momentum while maintaining macroeconomic stability.

title: 'Lived reputed life, GBA officials ruined it': Bengaluru techie‚Äôs death note
content: A Bengaluru software engineer tragically ended his life, citing harassment by a local family and BBMP officials over alleged building plan violations. A 10-page suicide note details accusations of extortion, with the family allegedly demanding Rs 20 lakh to cease the torment. Police have arrested the couple, with their son being sought.

title: ESA discovers butterfly-shaped crater on Mars showing impact, volcanism and water
content: Mars Express has found a unique butterfly-shaped crater on Mars. This formation resulted from a space rock hitting at a low angle. The impact ejected debris in two lobes, creating wing-like structures. Scientists believe subsurface ice or water may have been involved. The area also shows signs of ancient volcanic activity.

title: ‚ÄòIndiGo didn‚Äôt take off ‚Äî but my stress levels did‚Äô
content: A first-person account of the chaos and confusion as passengers across India struggled to board their IndiGo flights at Chennai airport

content: The police also found that a majority of the victims belong to the SC community and other middle-class families

content: DMK members stormed the Well of the Lok Sabha and tried to raise the issue of the lighting of the ‚ÄòKarthigai Deepam‚Äô at the stone lamp pillar on the Thirupparankundram hillock near Madurai

title: AAP's Raghav Chadha demands ban on 10-minute delivery services, protection for gig workers
content: He noted that while quick commerce have helped companies achieve billion-dollar valuations and become unicorns, the condition of gig workers remains worse than that of daily wage labourers

title: PTI, TASS sign agreement for exchange of news content on India, Russia
content: The agreement was inked by Vijay Joshi, PTI‚Äôs CEO and Editor-in-Chief, and TASS Director General Andrey Kondrashov on the sidelines of the India-Russia Business Forum

content: ‚ÄúIf you are unable to do so, the intervention of the court is the only option‚Ä¶ You would have to work it out or the court will make the appointment,‚Äù SC said

title: IndiGo mayhem continues: 31 flights cancelled at Chennai airport yet again
content: The flurry of IndiGo flight cancellations across the country has been triggered by poor planning of pilot rostering

title: Watch: IndiGo flight cancellations stretch into fourth straight day
content: Chaos persisted nationwide as IndiGo‚Äôs flight cancellations entered a fourth day. Delhi halted all departures till midnight, while Bengaluru saw over 100 cancellations. The airline blamed planning gaps in implementing new pilot rest norms. With more than 500 flights hit, disruptions spilled over to other carriers, prompting government intervention.

title: High Court rejects mosque's plea to use loudspeaker, says no religion mandates prayers with voice amplifiers
content: The Bench noted that the petitioner was unable to submit any material to show that the use of loudspeakers was mandatory/necessary to practice their religion

title: IndiGo flight cancellations LIVE: Short-term proactive cancellations done to ease ops, says airline; DGCA eases pilot flight duty norms
content: IndiGo‚Äôs on-time performance plummeted to 8.5% on Thursday, with worsening operational disruptions impacting flight schedules

title: MP Kota Srinivas Poojary urges Centre to hasten process of declaring Kundapura-Chikkamagaluru State Highway as NH
content: The proposal has received in principle approval, and the project is expected to enhance connectivity between the coast and the hinterlands and usher in economic development, says the MP

content: Information revealed in relation to allegations against the Palakkad¬†MLA is ‚Äòshocking and beyond comprehension‚Äô, says CM

content: The airline which generally operates around 2,300 domestic and international flights daily, is now cancelling flights as part of efforts to tackle disruptions, primarily triggered by crew woes

title: Supreme Court declines PIL on regulating AI use in judiciary, allows petitioner to submit suggestions to it
content: The CJI said although AI may assist with judicial tasks, it cannot replace or influence judicial reasoning

title: Delhi Blast case: Court extends NIA custody of accused Soyab by 10 days
content: Soyab is the seventh accused arrested by the NIA in the case, which is linked to a ‚Äúwhite-collar‚Äù terror module busted by the Jammu and Kashmir Police

title: Singju steps out of Manipur and finds new fans in Guwahati
content: Born in Meitei kitchens and shaped by seasonal produce, Singju is travelling far beyond Manipur, picking up new interpretations along the way

content: According to the Jaipur Meteorological Centre, minimum temperature remained below 10¬∞C across many regions

title: No penalties for delayed Waqf registration for next three months: Kiren Rijiju
content: The Union Minister urged the mutawallis to approach the tribunal, as under the Waqf (Amendment) Act, it has the authority to grant an extension

title: Supreme Court rejects plea that Arundhati Roy‚Äôs book cover promotes smoking
content: The court says both author and publisher were renowned names, and did not require the photo of her smoking a beedi to sell the book Mother Mary Comes to Me

title: About 1,250 more irrigation tanks in T.N. reach full level after Cyclone Ditwah
content: On November 24, the number of tanks that had attained 100% capacity was 2,614. On December 4, it was 3,865, according to¬†a comparison of the storage position of tanks for the two days

title: Tirupparankundram issue: People of Madurai want development politics, not other kinds of politics, says T.N. CM Stalin
content: In light of the Tirupparankundram row in Madurai, the CM asked in a social media post whether the city needed development politics or some other kind of politics

title: AIG Poonguzhali to supervise probe in second rape case against Kerala MLA Rahul Mamkootathil
content: Officials say the move assumes significance against the backdrop of possibility of more comparable ‚Äòme-too‚Äô disclosures surfacing in public domain against Mamkootathil. They note that Poonguzhali has considerable experience as nodal officer for victims who testified before Justice Hema Committee

title: Make SIR data public, stop pressure on BLOs: Akhilesh Yadav
content: Mr. Yadav alleged that attempts were being made to delete names of people belonging to Pichhda, Dalit, Alpasankhyak communities in various assembly constituencies

title: Congress leadership tussle: Who will lead Karnataka after 2025?
content: The internal faultlines between the Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah and Deputy Chief Minister D.K. Shivakumar camps have become all but apparent.

title: Civic official arrested in Virar building collapse that killed 17
content: Assistant Comissioner Gonsalves, who was in charge of ward C, failed to take action under the Maharashtra Regional and Town Planning (MRTP) Act, 1966, despite a structural audit flagging the building as dangerous and unauthorised

title: Three militants arrested in Manipur for threatening Sangai festival participants
content: ‚ÄúFive cases were registered in connection with the alleged threats by the proscribed G-5 to those who had attended the Sangai festival,‚Äù a senior officer said

title: Singapore High Commissioner among stranded passengers amid IndiGo's flight chaos
content: In a post on X, the official handle of Singapore HC in India, wrote that his flight to the Jharkhand town was cancelled unexpectedly, leaving him unable to attend the wedding of a young staff member

title: Watch: UN Security Council delegation visits Syria for first time since 1945
content: The UN Security Council visited Syria for the first time since 1945, signalling the country‚Äôs renewed global engagement under its new government.

title: White collar terror module: SIA raids in Srinagar, Ganderbal
content: Raids were carried out in Tufail Bhat‚Äôs residence, who was arrested by the SIA last month in connection with the "white collar" terror module case

title: Saffron shawl and hijab row resurfaces in Haveri district of Karnataka
content: The saffron shwal-hijab row resurfaced in Karnataka with some students wearing a saffron shawl after a few students started wearing hijab to class in C.G. Bellad Government First Grade College at Akki Alur of Haveri district

title: Canadian national held at Indo-Nepal border for using fake immigration stamp
content: Immigration and police officials said a fake stamp of the Delhi Airport Immigration Office was found on his passport

title: Adults can be in live-in relationship even without attaining marriageable age: Rajasthan HC
content: The court says the right to life and personal liberty under Article 21 of the Constitution cannot be denied merely because the petitioners are not of marriageable age

title: 92 IndiGo flight cancellations at Hyderabad airport on December 5 deepens chaos, three-day count reaches 197
content: RGIA police deployed additional personnel at the IndiGo enquiry counters to manage agitated passengers and prevent further disorder

title: Karnataka High Court sets aside third round provisional allotment list for MBBS and BDS courses, directs KEA to undertake process afresh
content: A three-judge bench delivered the unanimous verdict after the petitions were referred to the HC following the divergent judgment passed by a division bench on November 19

title: Major traffic restrictions in Delhi amid Putin's visit
content: Mr. Putin is expected to make diplomatic visits to Rajghat, Bharat Mandapam, Hyderabad House and Rashtrapati Bhavan among other places as part of his engagements

title: IndiGo flight disruptions persist, stranding hundreds at Kerala airports

While the government pitches it as a growth/ revenue booster, Opposition parties cite valuation anomalies and allege the move favours private interests.¬†M. content: Mahad marks the birthplace of one of India‚Äôs first human rights movements initiated by Dr. B. R. Ambedkar in 1927, challenging caste discrimination and asserting Dalit rights. It also shaped the idea of India and the ethics of its Constitution

title: World Soil Day: Grassland soils, not trees, anchor India‚Äôs climate resilience
content: Grasslands play a crucial role in creating healthy soils, primarily through their deep and fibrous root systems that enhance soil structure, and promote long-term carbon storage

title: From robotic surgery to radiation beams: understanding precision healing in oncology

title: Jawaharlal Nehru‚Äôs language of optimism and equality at the Madras Corporation
content: Aware that language was a politically sensitive issue in Tamil Nadu, the Prime Minister gave a promise in a speech in 1963¬†that ‚Äúany idea that any one language can dominate over others or, what is called linguistic imperialism, is totally unrealistic‚Äù. He also rejected the notion that one language would hamper the growth of the other language

title: A fort in the midst of a forest was a secret training ground for cavalry and elephants
content: In the early 1700s, King¬†Chellamuthu¬† Vijayaragunatha¬† Sethupathy¬†was gifted 200 horses by a Muslim businessman from¬†Thondi.¬†He built a fort in a dense tropical thorn forest, about 70 km from¬†Ramanathapuram. Here,¬†Sankarapathi, one of¬†Hyder¬† Ali‚Äôs commandants, trained these horses. Impressed by the tutelage, the king named the fort after him
